channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-4367] General patching problems on Windows
item.description:
As mentioned in the description, the patch:rollback ${patch-name} for Jboss Fuse 6.2.1. build nr. 71, causes some issues on windows.

1. The Fuse version displayed after starting remains JBoss Fuse (6.2.1.redhat-071), but it should be 6.2.0.redhat-133 again
2. There is always an exception: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not start JMX connector server

The Fuse output:

Please wait while JBoss Fuse is loading...
 
 47% [=================================>                                      ]Exception in thread "JMX Connector Thread
 
 [service:jmx:rmi://0.0.0.0:44444/jndi/rmi://0.0.0.0:1099/karaf-root]" java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not start JMX c
 
onnector server
 
        at org.apache.karaf.management.ConnectorServerFactory$1.run(ConnectorServerFactory.java:258)
 
Caused by: java.io.IOException: The server has been stopped.
 
        at javax.management.remote.rmi.RMIConnectorServer.start(RMIConnectorServer.java:351)
 
        at org.apache.karaf.management.ConnectorServerFactory$1.run(ConnectorServerFactory.java:245)
 
100% [========================================================================]
 
 
 
      _ ____                  ______
 
     | |  _ \                |  ____|
 
     | | |_) | ___  ___ ___  | |__ _   _ ___  ___
 
 _   | |  _ < / _ \/ __/ __| |  __| | | / __|/ _ \
 
| |__| | |_) | (_) \__ \__ \ | |  | |_| \__ \  __/
 
 \____/|____/ \___/|___/___/ |_|   \__,_|___/\___|
 
 
 
  JBoss Fuse (6.2.1.redhat-071)
 
  http://www.redhat.com/products/jbossenterprisemiddleware/fuse/
 
 
 
Hit '<tab>' for a list of available commands
 
and '[cmd] --help' for help on a specific command.

The Fuse log is attached

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.karaf.management.boot.KarafMBeanServerBuilder.setGuard(Ljava/lang/reflect/InvocationHandler;)V

hmm...

Hmm#2... I had no problems installing and rolling back.

The Fuse version displayed after starting remains JBoss Fuse (6.2.1.redhat-071),

it probably means that something is still running in the background.

Hi, I have installed the patch and tried to rollback it on multiple windows virtual machines, with different java distributions, but the result on my side is still the same. Are there any other additional steps, I should perform for the windows platform to be able to install and rollback the new patch?

Has any one in QE been able to install / rollback patch on windows?

We haven't been able to reproduce
I've tried to reproduce and I ended up with the same issue as Tomas Plevko had.
Lenka Vaskova you mean "java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not start JMX connector server" ?
Yes, exactly the same. (Exception and 6.2.1.redhat-071 instead of 6.2.0.redhat-133)
Could you please do the same steps on Linux?

Unresolved constraint in bundle org.ops4j.pax.url.mvn [165]: Singleton conflict.

on Linux it all is so simple...
on Windows ... I have a theory. We rely on one simple thing with standalone patching - we prepare a list of tasks to do after restart, then we restart framework (felix) with one simple (on Linux) flag:

File karafData = new File(bundleContext.getProperty("karaf.data"));
 
File cleanCache = new File(karafData, "clean_cache");
 
cleanCache.createNewFile();
 
bundleContext.getBundle(0l).stop();

when Karaf detects the "clean_cache" file, it simply removes all cached bundle data and we effectively start with clean state. Patch management will restore (from the list of prepared tasks) all previously installed features, bundles, data, etc.

And my theory is - on Windows there's problem deleting cached bundle data...
We wouldn't have singleton conflict otherwise. We just can't have both 2.4.0 and 2.4.2 pax-url bundles installed if the cache was truly cleared.

Guillaume Nodet, Jonathan Anstey, Hiram Chirino, Paolo Antinori what do you think? Is my reasoning correct?

Matej Melko, could you please cd into $FUSE_HOME/data/cache and do:

grep -r "mvn:" --include='bundle.info'|awk -F':' '{print $3 " -- " $1}'|sort

?
I suspect duplicate bundles with different versions (from before and after installing a patch)...
Guillaume Nodet, Jonathan Anstey, Hiram Chirino, Paolo Antinori what do you think?

This is actually the same issue as ENTESB-4438 - general git-related (or rather fast filesystem access related) problems on Windows.
I already saw (without even installing a patch):

  • not deleted patches/tmp/xxx directories which should be short-lived and removed after use
  • wrong history of user changes inside patches/.management/history - may be related to EOL handling on Windows.

I've finally fixed the problems under Windows - of course there was LF/CRLF problem and some file locks.

Hiram Chirino, there's only one thing left. After successfully installing rollup patch, I'm getting:

Rollup patch jboss-fuse-full-6.2.1.redhat-074 installed. Shutting down Karaf, please restart...
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root>
 
'MEKARAF_HOMEKARAF_BASEKARAF_DATAKARAF_DATAKARAF_ETCKARAF_ETCKARAF_OPTSMAINARGS' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
 
Restarting JVM...
 
Updating libs...
 
        1 dir(s) moved.
 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: ignoring option PermSize=128M; support was removed in 8.0
 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: ignoring option MaxPermSize=512M; support was removed in 8.0
 
Listening for transport dt_socket at address: 5005
 
Karaf can't startup, make sure the log file can be accessed and written by the user starting Karaf : java.io.IOException: Unable to delete file: C:\Dev\jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-133\data\log\fuse.log
 
C:\Dev\jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-133>

Fuse is correctly shut down, but there's an attempt to start it - just like an already updated bin/karaf.bat was picked up but with some wrong content ("\" replaced to ""?): 'MEKARAF_HOMEKARAF_BASEKARAF_DATAKARAF_DATAKARAF_ETCKARAF_ETCKARAF_OPTSMAINARGS' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file..
Do you know what may be wrong with karaf.bat script?
Resolved here - file locks on Windows and handling CRLF↔LF.

Hi Grzegorz Grzybek, I tried patch install && rollback on windows server 2012 r2 and I was unable to start fuse after rollback 

 
 
INFO : io.fabric8.patch.patch-management (1): Rolling back rollup patch "jboss-fuse-full-6.2.1.redhat-080"
 
Rollup patch jboss-fuse-full-6.2.1.redhat-080 rolled back. Restarting Karaf..
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root>
 
PS C:\jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-133> .\bin\fuse.bat
 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: ignoring option PermSize=128M; support was removed in 8.0
 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: ignoring option MaxPermSize=256M; support was removed in 8.0
 
Karaf can't startup, make sure the log file can be accessed and written by the user starting Karaf : java.io.IOException: Unable to delete file: C:\jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-133\data\log\fuse.
 
log

Ok, rollback continues if I start fuse again with bin\fuse.bat

Rollup patch jboss-fuse-full-6.2.1.redhat-080 rolled back. Restarting Karaf..
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root>
 
PS C:\jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-133> .\bin\fuse.bat

PS C:\jboss-fuse-6.2.0.redhat-133> .\bin\fuse.bat
 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: ignoring option PermSize=128M; support was removed in 8.0
 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: ignoring option MaxPermSize=256M; support was removed in 8.0
 
Please wait while JBoss Fuse is loading...
 
  6% [====>                                                                   ]INFO : io.fabric8.patch.patch-management (1): Restoring data directory for bundle org.apache.felix.configadmin
 
[8]
 
INFO : io.fabric8.patch.patch-management (1): Restoring data directory for bundle org.apache.felix.fileinstall [9]
 
 56% [========================================>                               ]log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate class [org.apache.log4j.SanitizingPatternLayout].
 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.log4j.SanitizingPatternLayout not found by org.ops4j.pax.logging.pax-logging-service [5]

        at org.apache.log4j.helpers.OptionConverter.instantiateByKey(OptionConverter.java:123)
 
        at org.apache.log4j.PaxLoggingConfigurator.parseAppender(PaxLoggingConfigurator.java:129)

        at org.apache.felix.cm.impl.helper.ManagedServiceTracker.updated(ManagedServiceTracker.java:189)

 62% [============================================>                           ]INFO : io.fabric8.patch.patch-management (1): Restoring data directory for bundle org.apache.aries.blueprint.co

      _ ____                  ______

and '[cmd] --help' for help on a specific command.
 
 
 
Open a browser to http://localhost:8181 to access the management console
 
 
 
Create a new Fabric via 'fabric:create'
 
or join an existing Fabric via 'fabric:join [someUrls]'
 
 
 
Hit '<ctrl-d>' or 'osgi:shutdown' to shutdown JBoss Fuse.
 
 
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> Resume rollback of rollup patch "jboss-fuse-full-6.2.1.redhat-080"
 
Restoring feature repository: mvn:io.fabric8/fabric8-karaf/1.2.0.redhat-133/xml/features
 
Restoring feature repository: mvn:org.apache.camel.karaf/apache-camel/2.15.1.redhat-620133/xml/features
 
Restoring feature repository: mvn:org.apache.karaf.assemblies.features/standard/2.4.0.redhat-620133/xml/features
 
Restoring feature repository: mvn:org.ops4j.pax.web/pax-web-features/3.2.3/xml/features
 
...

But after rollback welcome screen and and karaf version says 2.4.0.redhat-621080.
Except incorrect version in welcome screen it seems to rollback correctly.

Tomas Plevko, Hiram Chirino this is related to WIndows "feature" in running *.bat scripts. Rolling back a patch replaces bin/karaf.bat with old (from 6.2.0.GA) version, which simply can't rename lib.next back to lib directory. On Windows you have to do it manually,,,

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. execute steps as described in https://mojo.redhat.com/docs/DOC-1049758
2. after restart, execute patch:rollback on the newly installed patch
3. after restart, observe the issues
